intro: Truellum glomeratum, commonly known as the clustered truell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to partially sunny environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are pink to reddish in color. Truellum glomeratum is often found in wetlands and along the edges of streams, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
